Claim: A video is going viral on WhatsApp and Sharechat claiming that the man and woman in the video are doctors who treated 75 coronavirus patients and now they both are infected by it.
Explaination: The claim associated with the video is false and misleading. They are not Italian doctors who treated 75 coronavirus patients and got infected but are actors from a Mexican television series called ‘Triunfo del Amor’.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video is going viral on WhatsApp and Sharechat claiming that the man and woman in the video are doctors who treated 75 coronavirus patients and now they both are infected by it.

Explanation:The claim associated with the video is false and misleading. They are not Italian doctors who treated 75 coronavirus patients and got infected but are actors from a Mexican television series called ‘Triunfo del Amor’.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15461976

Claim: Goodwill laid off all employees due to COVID-19.
Explaination: This is a generalization and hasn't happened everywhere.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Goodwill laid off all employees due to COVID-19.

Explanation:This is a generalization and hasn't happened everywhere.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-goodwill-did-not-use-covid-19-as-an-excuse-to-fire-all-employees.html

Claim: Chennai municipal corporation has asked all vegetable and fruit markets to shut down.
Explaination: No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chennai municipal corporation has asked all vegetable and fruit markets to shut down.

Explanation:No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-viral-message-of-chennai-veggies-markets-shutting-due-to-coronavirus-is-a-hoax-1657146-2020-03-18

Claim: Politician Rahul Gandhi met a coronavirus patient in Waynad.
Explaination: The picture is from 2017.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Politician Rahul Gandhi met a coronavirus patient in Waynad.

Explanation:The picture is from 2017.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-congress-rahul-gandhi-wayanad-coronavirus-positive-patient-meeting-social-media-viral-news-1-1176156.html

Claim: In Ecuador, Maritza Frías, former director of the Teófilo Dávila Hospital in Machala, and Mauro Calle, former manager of this health center, concealed official figures of those infected.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:

Claim: There is a “positive” case of the novel coronavirus (nCoV) in a hospital in Banlic, Cabuyao City, Laguna, Philippines in January 2020.
Explaination: There was no coronavirus case at the Global Medical Center of Laguna around the time the claim was spread.
Label: False
html:
Claim: There is a “positive” case of the novel coronavirus (nCoV) in a hospital in Banlic, Cabuyao City, Laguna, Philippines in January 2020.

Explanation:There was no coronavirus case at the Global Medical Center of Laguna around the time the claim was spread.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/250677-positive-coronavirus-case-hospital-laguna

Claim: Chinese prime minister visits a mosque following the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: The man in the viral video is former Malaysian Prime Minister, Abdullah Ahmad Badawi. The video was shot during his visit to China when he visited Beijing’s Nan Xia Po Mosque in July 2015.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese prime minister visits a mosque following the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:The man in the viral video is former Malaysian Prime Minister, Abdullah Ahmad Badawi. The video was shot during his visit to China when he visited Beijing’s Nan Xia Po Mosque in July 2015.

http://newsmobile.in/articles/2020/02/05/chinese-pm-didnt-visit-mosque-following-coronavirus-outbreak-heres-the-fact-check/

Claim: Chinese are converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVID-19 in the country.
Explaination: The viral video is old and not related to coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese are converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVID-19 in the country.

Explanation:The viral video is old and not related to coronavirus.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14901149

Claim: Denmark passed from 200 new cases of COVID-19 in one day to only 26 cases.
Explaination: These numbers are not in line with the national authorities, it was never reported 200 or 26 news cases in one day in Denmark. On March 19, there were 75 new cases in the country.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Denmark passed from 200 new cases of COVID-19 in one day to only 26 cases.

Explanation:These numbers are not in line with the national authorities, it was never reported 200 or 26 news cases in one day in Denmark. On March 19, there were 75 new cases in the country.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-a-dinamarca-passou-de-200-para-26-novos-casos-de-coronavirus-num-so-dia/

Claim: Flu vaccine increases coronavirus risk 36%, says military study.
Explaination: More research is needed to provide a conclusive answer to the question of whether the flu shot increases the risk of non-influenza viral respiratory infections. It is important to keep in mind that while the flu vaccine cannot prevent COVID-19, it still provides several indirect benefits. For example, it reduces cases of flu and flu complications that require hospitalization, in turn reducing the burden on the healthcare system, which has become strained during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Label: No evidence
html:
Claim: Flu vaccine increases coronavirus risk 36%, says military study.

Explanation:More research is needed to provide a conclusive answer to the question of whether the flu shot increases the risk of non-influenza viral respiratory infections. It is important to keep in mind that while the flu vaccine cannot prevent COVID-19, it still provides several indirect benefits. For example, it reduces cases of flu and flu complications that require hospitalization, in turn reducing the burden on the healthcare system, which has become strained during the COVID-19 pandemic.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/claim-that-flu-vaccine-increases-coronavirus-infection-is-unsupported-misinterprets-scientific-studies/

Claim: Compounds in tea can help cure COVID-19.
Explaination: Methylxanthine, theobromine and theophylline, which are found in tea, are good for health and airway management, but cannot cure COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Compounds in tea can help cure COVID-19.

Explanation:Methylxanthine, theobromine and theophylline, which are found in tea, are good for health and airway management, but cannot cure COVID-19.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-post-claiming-that-compounds-found-in-tea-can-cure-covid-19-is-a-hoax-642990a55009?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: An image has been shared alongside a claim that shows China administering the “world’s first new coronavirus vaccine” after the global outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
Explaination: The photos in this image have circulated in reports about China testing a potential COVID-19 vaccine.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: An image has been shared alongside a claim that shows China administering the “world’s first new coronavirus vaccine” after the global outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.

Explanation:The photos in this image have circulated in reports about China testing a potential COVID-19 vaccine.

https://factcheck.afp.com/image-has-circulated-reports-about-china-testing-potential-covid-19-vaccine-has-not-been-approved?check=1

Claim: COVID-19 is a hoax or scapegoat for economic disaster.
Explaination: Came from conspiracy-related source and data and many reports worldwide confirm deaths from coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: COVID-19 is a hoax or scapegoat for economic disaster.

Explanation:Came from conspiracy-related source and data and many reports worldwide confirm deaths from coronavirus.

Label: False

Claim: A post shared thousands of times on Facebook lists companies whose chief executive officers have allegedly stepped down during the novel coronavirus crisis.
Explaination: some of the 19 CEOs remain in their positions, while the announcements that others were leaving came before the virus emerged in late 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post shared thousands of times on Facebook lists companies whose chief executive officers have allegedly stepped down during the novel coronavirus crisis.

Explanation:some of the 19 CEOs remain in their positions, while the announcements that others were leaving came before the virus emerged in late 2019.

https://factcheck.afp.com/ceos-these-companies-did-not-all-step-down-during-novel-coronavirus-crisis

Claim: This photo shows the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The photo is a magnified photo of a weevil.
Label: False
html:
Claim: This photo shows the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The photo is a magnified photo of a weevil.

https://factcheck.afp.com/no-magnified-photo-weevil

Claim: The coronavirus is “simply the common cold.”
Explaination: The 2019 coronavirus is part of a family of viruses that produce illnesses ranging from the common cold to more critical diseases such as SARS or MERS, but is a new virus that had not been previously identified.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The coronavirus is “simply the common cold.”

Explanation:The 2019 coronavirus is part of a family of viruses that produce illnesses ranging from the common cold to more critical diseases such as SARS or MERS, but is a new virus that had not been previously identified.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/09/facebook-posts/2019-coronavirus-isnt-common-cold/

Claim: Video says President Donald Trump spawned the “Wuhan super virus outbreak under code name ‘zyphr.’”
Explaination: There’s no evidence that President Trump had anything to do with the creation of the coronavirus.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Video says President Donald Trump spawned the “Wuhan super virus outbreak under code name ‘zyphr.’”

Explanation:There’s no evidence that President Trump had anything to do with the creation of the coronavirus.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/03/youtube-videos/no-trump-did-not-create-coronavirus/

Claim: A photo shows a Japanese medical professional providing aid in Wuhan.
Explaination: This photo has circulated in reports about a Japanese medical team travelling to China in 2008.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo shows a Japanese medical professional providing aid in Wuhan.

Explanation:This photo has circulated in reports about a Japanese medical team travelling to China in 2008.

http://u.afp.com/japanmedicalteam

Claim: A Facebook post asserts the U.S. developed a COVID-19 vaccine to release this Sunday.
Explaination: Currently, there are still no definitive and institutionalised vaccines for COVID-19; nonetheless, research persists and holds potential solutions.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Facebook post asserts the U.S. developed a COVID-19 vaccine to release this Sunday.

Explanation:Currently, there are still no definitive and institutionalised vaccines for COVID-19; nonetheless, research persists and holds potential solutions.

https://dubawa.org/covid-19-still-without-a-definite-cure-amid-clinical-trials/

Claim: Empty hospital lots and waiting rooms are indicative of a coronavirus hoax.
Explaination: No evidence cited, no authorities interviewed and didn't go into hospitals.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Empty hospital lots and waiting rooms are indicative of a coronavirus hoax.

Explanation:No evidence cited, no authorities interviewed and didn't go into hospitals.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/Fact-Check-COVID-19-Is-NOT-A-Hoax-Proven-By-Empty-Hospital-Lots-Waiting-Rooms.html

Claim: Russian President Putin released 500 lions onto the streets to keep people indoors.
Explaination: The screen grab in the post was taken from a movie, not a real news report.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Russian President Putin released 500 lions onto the streets to keep people indoors.

Explanation:The screen grab in the post was taken from a movie, not a real news report.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Russia's-Putin-Did-NOT-Release-500-Lions-To-Keep-People-Indoors-Amid-Coronavirus.html

Claim: A video shows a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown.
Explaination: False: The video does not show a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown. The family was reported to have died of carbon monoxide poisoning in Dec 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown.

Explanation:False: The video does not show a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown. The family was reported to have died of carbon monoxide poisoning in Dec 2019.

https://medium.com/annie-lab/false-this-video-does-not-show-a-family-killed-by-the-coronavirus-amid-chinas-multi-city-lockdown-4871af69fd6f

Claim: Chart compares COVID-19 with other longstanding diseases.
Explaination: The graphic is misleading and risks underplaying the danger of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, which is a new disease with a fast-rising mortality rate.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Chart compares COVID-19 with other longstanding diseases.

Explanation:The graphic is misleading and risks underplaying the danger of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, which is a new disease with a fast-rising mortality rate.

https://factcheck.afp.com/health-experts-say-comparing-death-tolls-emerging-epidemic-longstanding-diseases-risks-underplaying

Claim: All fruit and vegetable markets in the Indian city of Chennai and across the state of Tamil Nadu have been ordered to close in an effort to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake”, and Tamil Nadu’s chief minister said that stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: All fruit and vegetable markets in the Indian city of Chennai and across the state of Tamil Nadu have been ordered to close in an effort to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake”, and Tamil Nadu’s chief minister said that stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.

https://factcheck.afp.com/indian-authorities-refute-fake-claim-about-food-markets-closing-chennai-during-covid-19-lockdown

Claim: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.

https://factcheck.afp.com/sri-lankan-authorities-say-medical-facilities-hospital-will-remain-open-all-covid-19-patients?check=1

Claim: “if your child gets this virus, they’re going to the hospital alone in a van with people they don’t know, to be with people they don’t know. You will be at home without them in their time of need.”
Explaination: It’s illegal to treat a minor without parental consent in the U.S. Even as hospitals are limiting visitors, minors will always be allowed to have one guardian present.
Label: Pants on Fire!
ann23_remarks: doesn't really seem to fit any category (maybe social alarm?
html:
Claim: “if your child gets this virus, they’re going to the hospital alone in a van with people they don’t know, to be with people they don’t know. You will be at home without them in their time of need.”

Explanation:It’s illegal to treat a minor without parental consent in the U.S. Even as hospitals are limiting visitors, minors will always be allowed to have one guardian present.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/02/viral-image/hospitalized-children-can-have-one-parent-present/

Claim: Does Mexico have confirmed cases of COVID-19?
Explaination: Johns Hopkins coronavirus Resource Center has records showing Mexico has COVID-19 cases.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Does Mexico have confirmed cases of COVID-19?

Explanation:Johns Hopkins coronavirus Resource Center has records showing Mexico has COVID-19 cases.

https://leadstories.com/cgi-bin/mt/mt-search.cgi?search=coronavirus&IncludeBlogs=1&blog_id=1&limit=10&page=6

Claim: A “Wuhan super virus” was created in a Chinese biosecurity lab and has infected more than 100,000 people in Wuhan.
Explaination: There is no evidence that the 2019 Novel coronavirus came from a Chinese laboratory. The WHO says the virus most likely originated in an animal. The number of cases of infection with the coronavirus in Wuhan has not reached 100,000 as claimed in the video.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A “Wuhan super virus” was created in a Chinese biosecurity lab and has infected more than 100,000 people in Wuhan.

Explanation:There is no evidence that the 2019 Novel coronavirus came from a Chinese laboratory. The WHO says the virus most likely originated in an animal. The number of cases of infection with the coronavirus in Wuhan has not reached 100,000 as claimed in the video.

https://factcheck.aap.com.au/social-media-claims/no-evidence-2019-coronavirus-came-from-a-chinese-lab

Claim: A Chinese person, who was taken from Kansai airport (in Osaka, Japan) to a hospital, has run away before they could be tested.
Explaination: According to the Kansai Airport Quarantine Station, this information is absolutely false.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Chinese person, who was taken from Kansai airport (in Osaka, Japan) to a hospital, has run away before they could be tested.

Explanation:According to the Kansai Airport Quarantine Station, this information is absolutely false.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kotahatachi/unknown-cause-china

Claim: A former and controversial CIA officer said coronavirus was made in a lab.
Explaination: The quote was pulled out of context and was mere speculation, not fact.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A former and controversial CIA officer said coronavirus was made in a lab.

Explanation:The quote was pulled out of context and was mere speculation, not fact.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471899-fact-check-former-cia-intel-officer-did-not-say-coronavirus-was-produced-in-a-laboratory.html

Claim: Did genetic mutations cause the coronavirus to become more dangerous.
Explaination: Infectious disease specialist said no proof that mutation specifically caused virus to be more dangerous.
Label: Partially true
html:
Claim: Did genetic mutations cause the coronavirus to become more dangerous.

Explanation:Infectious disease specialist said no proof that mutation specifically caused virus to be more dangerous.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-NO-Proof-That-Genetic-Mutations-Responsible-For-Coronavirus's-Virulence.html

Claim: 31 coronavirus patients have recovered in Ghana.
Explaination: The Ghana Health Service says only 3 coronavirus patients in Ghana have recovered.
Label: False
html:
Claim: 31 coronavirus patients have recovered in Ghana.

Explanation:The Ghana Health Service says only 3 coronavirus patients in Ghana have recovered.

https://ghanafact.com/false-31-coronavirus-patients-recover-in-ghana/

Claim: Two Filipinos ate bat soup in Wuhan, China, the epicenter of the 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV), as seen in a video uploaded on Facebook.
Explaination: The original video was taken in Palau and was uploaded on YouTube on July 17, 2019 – at least 5 months before a case of the 2019-nCoV was first reported in Wuhan, China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Two Filipinos ate bat soup in Wuhan, China, the epicenter of the 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV), as seen in a video uploaded on Facebook.

Explanation:The original video was taken in Palau and was uploaded on YouTube on July 17, 2019 – at least 5 months before a case of the 2019-nCoV was first reported in Wuhan, China.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/251715-video-filipinos-eating-bats-wuhan-china
